The idea of ketchup is thought to have originated in China in the 17th century, when a fish-based sauce called ke-tsiap was served. This sauce was later adapted by British traders and brought to the West, where it evolved into the ketchup we know today.

Ketchup is believed to have originated in China during the 17th century as a fish-based sauce. It was later adapted by British colonists in the 18th century and eventually became the tomato-based condiment that is popular today.
